p: The general guideline to initial ventilator settings includes the assist control (AC) mode with a tidal volume 4 - 8 mL/kg ideal predicted body weight; respiratory rate 25 - 30 breaths/min; positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) 10 - 15 cm H 2O; target SpO 2 90-96%; plateau pressure less than 30 cm H 2O. The L type patients tolerate lower PEEP (< 10 cm H 2O) and higher tidal volume (7 - 9 mL/kg). In these patients, higher PEEP redirects blood flow and creates dead space, while higher tidal volumes for hypercapnia are well tolerated due to high compliance. The H type patients, with low lung compliance, need higher PEEP (< 15 cm H 2O) and lower tidal volumes (5 - 7 mL/kg) [ 17].
